intro: Iguanura kelantanensis, commonly known as the Kelantan iguana plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Malaysia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the nutrient-rich soils of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
